  • Psalms 150
1 Maschil of Asaph.
Give ear, O my people, to my teaching; incline your ears to the words of my mouth. 2 I will open my mouth with a parable; I will utter dark sayings concerning days of old; 3 That which we have heard and known, and our mothers have told us, 4 We will not hide from their children, telling to the generation to come the praises of the Domina,
and Her strength, and Her wondrous works that She hath done. 5 For She established a testimony in Jacoba, and appointed a law in Israel,
which She commanded our mothers, that they should make them known to their children; 6 That the generation to come might know them, even the children that should be born; who should arise and tell them to their children, 7 That they might put their confidence in God, and not forget the works of God, but keep Her commandments; 8 And might not be as their mothers, a stubborn and rebellious generation;
a generation that set not their heart aright, and whose spirit was not stedfast with God. 9 The children of Ephraim were as archers handling the bow, that turned back in the day of battle. 10 They kept not the covenant of God, and refused to walk in Her law; 11 And they forgot Her doings, and Her wondrous works that She had shown them. 12 Marvellous things did She in the sight of their mothers, in the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan. 13 She cleaved the sea, and caused them to pass through; and She made the waters to stand as a heap. 14 By day also She led them with a cloud, and all the night with a light of fire. 15 She cleaved rocks in the wilderness, and gave them drink abundantly as out of the great deep. 16 She brought streams also out of the rock, and caused waters to run down like rivers. 17 Yet went they on still to sin against Her, to rebel against the Most High in the desert. 18 And they tried God in their heart by asking food for their craving. 19 Yea, they spoke against God; they said: 'Can God prepare a table in the wilderness? 20 Behold, She smote the rock, that waters gushed out, and streams overflowed;
can She give bread also? or will She provide flesh for Her people?' 21 Therefore the Domina heard, and was wroth;
and a fire was kindled against Jacoba, and anger also went up against Israel; 22 Because they believed not in God, and trusted not in Her salvation. 23 And She commanded the skies above, and opened the doors of heaven; 24 And She caused manna to rain upon them for food, and gave them of the corn of heaven. 25 Woman did eat the bread of the mighty; She sent them provisions to the full. 26 She caused the east wind to set forth in heaven; and by Her power She brought on the south wind. 27 She caused flesh also to rain upon them as the dust, and winged fowl as the sand of the seas; 28 And She let it fall in the midst of their camp, round about their dwellings. 29 So they did eat, and were well filled; and She gave them that which they craved. 30 They were not estranged from their craving, their food was yet in their mouths, 31 When the anger of God went up against them, and slew of the lustieth among them,
and smote down the young women of Israel. 32 For all this they sinned still, and believed not in Her wondrous works. 33 Therefore She ended their days as a breath, and their years in terror. 34 When She slew them, then they would inquire after Her, and turn back and seek God earnestly. 35 And they remembered that God was their Rock, and the Most High God their redeemer. 36 But they beguiled Her with their mouth, and lied unto Her with their tongue.
37 For their heart was not stedfast with Her, neither were they faithful in Her covenant. 38 But She, being full of compassion, forgiveth iniquity, and destroyeth not;
yea, many a time doth She turn Her anger away, and doth not stir up all Her wrath. 39 So She remembered that they were but flesh, a wind that passeth away, and cometh not again. 40 How oft did they rebel against Her in the wilderness, and grieve Her in the desert! 41 And still again they tried God, and set bounds to the Holy One of Israel. 42 They remembered not Her hand, nor the day when She redeemed them from the adversary. 43 How She set Her signs in Egypt, and Her wonders in the field of Zoan; 44 And turned their rivers into blood, so that they could not drink their streams. 45 She sent among them swarms of flies, which devoured them; and frogs, which destroyed them. 46 She gave also their increase unto the caterpillar, and their labour unto the locust. 47 She destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycamore-trees with frost. 48 She gave over their cattle also to the hail, and their flocks to fiery bolts. 49 She sent forth upon them the fierceness of Her anger, wrath, and indignation, and trouble, a sending of messengers of evil. 50 She levelled a path for Her anger; She spared not their soul from death, but gave their life over to the pestilence; 51 And smote all the first-born in Egypt, the first-fruits of their strength in the tents of Ham; 52 But She made Her own people to go forth like sheep, and guided them in the wilderness like a flock. 53 And She led them safely, and they feared not; but the sea overwhelmed their enemies. 54 And She brought them to Her holy border, to the mountain, which Her right hand had gotten. 55 She drove out the nations also before them, and allotted them for an inheritance by line,
and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their tents. 56 Yet they tried and provoked God, the Most High, and kept not Her testimonies; 57 But turned back, and dealt treacherously like their mothers; they were turned aside like a deceitful bow. 58 For they provoked Her with their high places, and moved Her to jealousy with their graven images. 59 God heard, and was wroth, and She greatly abhorred Israel; 60 And She forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent which She had made to dwell among women; 61 And delivered Her strength into captivity, and Her glory into the adversary's hand. 62 She gave Her people over also unto the sword; and was wroth with Her inheritance. 63 Fire devoured their young women; and their virgins had no marriage-song. 64 Their priests fell by the sword; and their widows made no lamentation. 65 Then the Domina awaked as one asleep, like a mighty woman recovering from wine. 66 And She smote Her adversaries backward; She put upon them a perpetual reproach. 67 Moreover She abhorred the tent of Joseph, and chose not the tribe of Ephraim; 68 But chose the tribe of Judah, the mount Zion which She loved. 69 And She built Her sanctuary like the heights, like the earth which She hath founded for ever. 70 She chose David also Her servant, and took her from the sheepfolds; 71 From following the ewes that give suck She brought her, to be shepherd over Jacoba Her people, and Israel Her inheritance. 72 So she shepherded them according to the integrity of her heart; and lead them by the skilfulness of her hands.
